body_html: @teng-li We don't test the TCPStore functionality there directly -- it still uses the TEST_MASTER_PORT constant when the init method is env, and only then will use the TCPStore. I have not seen this cause problems with this fixed port approach but we can revisit if it shows up as flaky.
body_text: @teng-li We don't test the TCPStore functionality there directly -- it still uses the TEST_MASTER_PORT constant when the init method is env, and only then will use the TCPStore. I have not seen this cause problems with this fixed port approach but we can revisit if it shows up as flaky.
body: @teng-li We don't test the TCPStore functionality there directly -- it still uses the `TEST_MASTER_PORT` constant when the init method is env, and only then will use the TCPStore. I have not seen this cause problems with this fixed port approach but we can revisit if it shows up as flaky.
